content.description:
At a certain height, a tree trunk has a circular cross section. The radius R(t) of that cross section grows at a rate modeled by the function

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>R</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>16</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4760@</annotation> </semantics> </math> centimeters per year for

0 ≤ t ≤ 3 , where time t is measured in years. At time t = 0, the radius is 6 centimeters. The area of the cross section at time t is denoted by A(t).
content.question: Evaluate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <msup> <mi>A</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F70@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Using appropriate units, interpret the meaning of that integral in terms of cross-sectional area.

frqParts.text: Evaluate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <msup> <mi>A</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F70@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Using appropriate units, interpret the meaning of that integral in terms of cross-sectional area.

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
